result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Lee Martinez

records.addlTxt: Atty Leichsenring received and waives reading of Information.  DE advised of charges and penalties.
Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2

3:29 PM Defendant Christopher Lee Martinez in court, in custody.  Attorney Jesse Lee Leichsenring in court for Christopher Lee Martinez.  Attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for State of Wisconsin.  States moves to dismiss but read in case.  Court grants the motion and dismisses but reads in case.
Plea hearing on June 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 007396,
Payable Number: 251547,
Receipt Number: 22R 011924,
Amount: $20.00

9:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher Lee Martinez in court, in custody.  Attorney Jesse Lee Leichsenring and Atty Allison Markoski in court for Christopher Lee Martinez.  Court states cases and appearances.  Court notes matter is set for a plea hearing today.  Atty Markoski is moving to withdraw on 22CF128 and 22CF214 and 22CF237 at the DE's request and new counsel would be appointed by the PD's office.  DE is in agreement.  Court questions DE on his understanding and notes those 3 matters are/will be set for PH in August.  Court will allow Atty Markoski to withdraw in those 3 cases and new counsel to be appointed.  22CF214 will be added for a PH on 8/18/22 at 9:30 a.m. to track with 22CF128 and 22CF237.  Court questions Atty Leichsenring on status of his cases noting 22CF39 still needs a PH.  Atty Leichsenring notes he will be filing a motion to withdraw as well noting one of the cases is set for trial in 9 days.  Court notes that's a Br 1 case.  Court explains why all matters were set in her Branch as she has the oldest felony but notes each branch has some of these cases.  State notes all 22CF cases still need a PH so asks that all those be kicked back to the right branch for PH.  21CF130 is set for a JT in Br 1 in 9 days.  State notes there may also be some more criminal charges coming down the pipe.  Court will focus on the Br 2 matters only - 22CF39.  Court will have that matter set for PH but unsure about when to set it for.  State would agree to have all 4 matters set for PH at the same date/time - 8/18/2022.  Court orders PH set in 22CF39 at 9:30 and blocks off 9:45 also.  Court won't take any action on the motions to withdraw as each branch will need to address those as well as scheduling on an individual basis.  Atty Markoski notes she has filed a motion to modify bond but the Court won't hear it as she's been allowed to withdraw.  That motion can be addressed once new counsel is appointed.  State agrees.
Plea hearing on June 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on April 8, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Return date on June 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Special bond conditions as follows: Booking Today

01:25 PM Defendant Christopher Lee Martinez in court.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  DE confirms address.  $5,000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Booking Today  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 10:45 am.  Return date scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
